head.title: 4 New York Women Die When Their Car Plunges From Roof

identified-content.org: St Vincent's Hospital and Medical Center (NYC)

hedline.hl1: 4 New York Women Die When Their Car Plunges From Roof

abstract.p: Four longtime nurses at St Vincents Hospital in Manhattan are killed in freak accident in Virginia Beach, Va, when their car crashes through wall of fifth-floor motel parking deck and tumbles 41 feet to ground (S)

block.p: Four longtime nurses at St. Vincents Hospital in Manhattan were killed yesterday in a freak accident in Virginia Beach, Va., when their car crashed through the wall of a fifth-floor motel parking deck and tumbled 41 feet to the ground, the police said.
The cause of the crash is still under investigation, but alcohol and excessive speed have been ruled out, said Don Rimer, a spokesman for the Virginia Beach police.

Four longtime nurses at St. Vincents Hospital in Manhattan were killed yesterday in a freak accident in Virginia Beach, Va., when their car crashed through the wall of a fifth-floor motel parking deck and tumbled 41 feet to the ground, the police said.
The cause of the crash is still under investigation, but alcohol and excessive speed have been ruled out, said Don Rimer, a spokesman for the Virginia Beach police.

The car landed on a walkway that connects the street to the boardwalk, but though it was a sunny afternoon during the city's annual Neptune Festival and there were thousands of pedestrians in the area, no one on the ground was hurt, Mr. Rimer said.

The women -- Joan Ellen Walsh, 56, and Mary Ann Dono, 60, both of Brooklyn; Mary Ann Going, 60, of Elmhurst, Queens; and Kathleen M. Mollick, 63, of Manhattan -- were staying at the Sandcastle Oceanfront Motel, Mr. Rimer said.

At 12:30 p.m. yesterday, Ms. Walsh, with the three other women as passengers, drove her 1999 Honda Accord up the ramp to the open-air top deck of the lot adjoining the motel, but did not stop, Mr. Rimer said. The car smashed through a four-foot-high cinder-block wall, did a half-flip in the air and landed on its roof, killing the women instantly, he said.
The four women were on vacation and had arrived several days ago, Mr. Rimer added.
